titleStmt.title: The ladies delight: or, Narcissus his love-flower. A pleasant and delightful new ditty, made by a lover, for ladies so witty; when to Venus sports they please to resort, to pull sweet flowers, that yields the best sport. To the tune of, Narcissus come kisse us, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for W[illiam]. Thackeray, T[homas]. Passenger, and W[illiam]. Whitwood.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I was walking I cannot tell when ..."
Date and publisher's names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
